result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use Oleoresin Device-Harm/Crime, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.26(4)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence and 14CM002583.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: COURT FINDS DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE DOSAGE PROBATION PROGRAM AND WILL REFER THE DEFENDANT TO THAT PROGRAM.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees. To be paid during period of probation/Extended Supervision.
If revoked, up to 25% of prison funds. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
*Restitution set at zero.

Provide a biological specimen DNA, to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms/weapons/OC spray at any time in the future.
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Mental Health Unit for assessment and follow up treatment. Take prescribed medications.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings.
No contact with the Pick N Save locations at 4279 S. 76 Street in the City of Greenfield, Milwaukee County, WI. and 6442 S. 27 Street in the City of Oak Creek, Milwaukee County, WI.
AODA assessment with follow p treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens. No positive results.

timeConds.notes: To be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Joseph Farrell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.
 
COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, to run consecutive to any other sentence; and 14CM002583, with credit for 62 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

The Court IMPOSED AND STAYED this sentence and placed the Defendant on probation for a period of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions as to Probation / Extended Supervision:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period of probation; or, if revoked, up to 25% of prison funds. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Mental Health Unit for assessment and follow up treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  No contact with the Pic N Save locations at 4279 S. 76th Street in the City of Greenfield, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin; and 6462 S. 27th Street in the City of Oak Creek, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (NDA) to the State Crime Lab for testing
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / weapons / OC Spray at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Dosage Probation Program and will refer the Defendant to that program.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS at the House of Correction to be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Robbery with Use of Force  TO  Use of Oleoresin Device - Harm/Crime under Wisconsin Stats. 941.26(4)(3), and 939.50(3)(h) a Class H Felony.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.

Attorney Golden telephones the court requesting this matter be scheduled sooner than the currently scheduled plea/sentencing date of 7/6/15.  Attorney Golden will notify the State regarding the re-calendaring of this matter.  Defendant needs to be produced from the House of Corrections.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell in custody.  Megan Carmody for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Pick n Save stores in Milwaukee County

Defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Thomas Joseph Farrell in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
